definition: to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom)/to anxiously await
to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: For now, though, Chinese filmgoers can only wait.
sentences.chinese: 現在中國觀衆能做的只有翹首以待了。
